TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit GacIdentityPermission extends System.Security.CodeAccessPermission
Public NotInheritable Class GacIdentityPermission Inherits CodeAccessPermission
public ref class GacIdentityPermission sealed : System::Security::CodeAccessPermission

Docs.summary: Defines the identity permission for files originating in the global assembly cache. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Files are either in the global assembly cache, or they are not. There are no variations to the permission granted, so all <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission> objects are equal.
> [!IMPORTANT] > Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], identity permissions are not used. > > In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 and 1.1, demands on the identity permissions are effective even when the calling assembly is fully trusted. That is, although the calling assembly has full trust, a demand for an identity permission fails if the assembly does not meet the demanded criteria. Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, demands for identity permissions are ineffective if the calling assembly has full trust. This assures consistency for all permissions, eliminating the treatment of identity permissions as a special case.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This constructor creates a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission> with a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> value of <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.None>.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission.%23ctor> constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState state) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with fully restricted .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > In the .NET Framework versions 1.0 and 1.1, identity permissions cannot have an <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted> permission state value. Starting with the .NET Framework version 2.0, identity permissions can have any permission state value. This means that in 2.0 and later versions, identity permissions have the same behavior as permissions that implement the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.IUnrestrictedPermission> interface.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission.%23ctor%28System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState%29?displayProperty=nameWithType> constructor.
[!code-cpp[System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission#7](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission/CPP/gacidentitypermission.cpp#7)] [!code-csharp[System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission/CS/gacidentitypermission.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission/VB/gacidentitypermission.vb#7)]

Public Overrides Function Copy () As IPermission

Docs.summary: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission.
Docs.returns: A copy of the current permission.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A copy of a permission represents the same access to resources as the original permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void FromXml(class System.Security.SecurityElement securityElement) cil managed

Docs.param: A that contains the XML encoding to use to create the permission.
Docs.summary: Creates a permission from an XML encoding.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission.FromXml%2A> method creates a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission> from an XML encoding defined by a <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> object. Use the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission.ToXml%2A> method to XML-encode the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission>, including state information.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Intersect(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed
Public Overrides Function Intersect (target As IPermission) As IPermission

Docs.param: A permission to intersect with the current permission. It must be of the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Creates and returns a permission that is the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.
Docs.returns: A new permission that represents the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission. The new permission is if the intersection is empty.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The intersection of two permissions is a permission that describes the set of operations they both describe in common. Only a demand that passes both original permissions will pass the intersection.
A <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission> only supports set operations (the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission.IsSubsetOf%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission.Intersect%2A>, and <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission.Union%2A> methods) when the current permission is equal to the specified permission.

Docs.exception: is not and is not of the same type as the current permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsSubsetOf(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed
Public Overrides Function IsSubsetOf (target As IPermission) As Boolean

Docs.param: A permission object to test for the subset relationship. The permission must be of the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Indicates whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.
Docs.returns: if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The current permission is a subset of the specified permission if the current permission represents a set of operations that is wholly contained by the specified permission. If this method returns `true`, the current permission represents no more access to the protected resource than does the specified permission.
A <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission> only supports set operations (the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission.IsSubsetOf%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission.Intersect%2A>, and <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission.Union%2A> methods) when the current permission is equal to the specified permission.

Docs.exception: is not and is not of the same type as the current permission.

Public Overrides Function ToXml () As SecurityElement

Docs.summary: Creates an XML encoding of the permission and its current state.
Docs.returns: A that represents the XML encoding of the permission, including any state information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission.FromXml%2A> method to create a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission> from a <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Union(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed
Public Overrides Function Union (target As IPermission) As IPermission

Docs.param: A permission to combine with the current permission. It must be of the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Creates and returns a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
Docs.returns: A new permission that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The result of a call to the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission.Union%2A> method is a permission that includes all the operations represented by both the current permission and the specified permission. Any demand that passes either permission passes their union.
A <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission> only supports set operations (the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission.IsSubsetOf%2A>, <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission.Intersect%2A>, and <xref:System.Security.Permissions.GacIdentityPermission.Union%2A> methods) when the current permission is equal to the specified permission.

Docs.exception: is not and is not of the same type as the current permission.
